title: Gallery Talk: What’s New in Modern Art?
hero_caption: Claude Cahun. Object, 1936. Through prior gift of Mrs. Gilbert W. Chapman.
description:
Take a walk through the Modern Art collection with Gary C. and Frances Comer Curator of International Modern Art Caitlin Haskell, and discuss artworks that are new on view or particularly relevant. Highlights of the fall tour include artist Claude Cahun’s Object (1936); a selection of paintings by Fernand Léger offering a fresh appreciation of his scope as an artist; and Pablo Picasso’s iconic cubist portrait Daniel-Henry Kahnweiler (1910), recently returned from exhibition abroad.   

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program. 

Please note that the image on this page is for reference purposes only and may not be featured during the gallery talk.
